H0.text: A complex organism is a unicellular organism best described as being.

H1.text: A microorganism is best described as a unicellular organism.

H2.text: An organism with specialized cells is a unicellular organism best described as being.

H3.text: An organism with different types of tissues is best described as a unicellular organism.

A4.text: Microorganisms are extremely diverse, representing most unicellular organisms in all three domains of life: two of the three domains, Archaea and Bacteria, only contain microorganisms.

A5.text: In the Charales, which are the algae most closely related to higher plants, cells differentiate into several distinct tissues within the organism.
